text: <@U115YGEH1|mtakemiya> has joined the channel
<!here|@here> does anyone understand why we remap port 5000 to 3000 in vagrant?

I ask because those of us developing clients are then left with the dilemma of picking a sensible default targeting either native or vagrant…if theres a good reason for the remap then so be it…but if not, it seems it would make more sense to set them the same.
<@U0KPFAZNF>: I am not a fan of the mapping.   It has caused confusion for new engineers.
i would at least like to understand why its there
perhaps there was a reason that is not apparent
<@U18UG9K9S|adriano> has joined the channel
<@U0KPFAZNF> that's a question for <@U0UKTPMG8> I believe
<@U0KPFAZNF>: <@U11HTMW0H> think it is simply a holdover from initial setup
<@U0UKTPMG8>: ok, should we try to unify them?  I assume we should just map 5000->5000 but let me know if it should be the opposite.
believe that is accurate, as the core.yaml shows the REST address value of 0.0.0.0:5000
be sure to advertise this to <@U0Z81GL6S> as she uses this for much of her dev/testing
ok, will do
:slightly_smiling_face:

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F1A95546Q/-.sh|Untitled> and commented: <@U0TFEHX8E>: while working on this patch, I noticed we are doing a “go install -a” for protoc-gen-go.  Do you know why?

file.title: Untitled

commit c376d078b6812a727822420a1f67783ecdd32f12
Author: Gregory Haskins <gregory.haskins@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 11:11:51 2016 -0400
​
    Move go-tool compilation to the Makefile

initial_comment.comment: <@U0TFEHX8E>: while working on this patch, I noticed we are doing a “go install -a” for protoc-gen-go.  Do you know why?

text: specifically, i mean why the -a switch
that works in the vagrant provisioner because it runs as root, but it doesnt run as a makefile rule without sudo
I don’t remember and there may not be a good reason. I can try removing it later this afternoon or tomorrow and see if there’s any impact
when running make protos
ok, cool…i think you already understand this but just in case not:  without the patch above, that go-install happens during vagrant provisioning so you would need to destroy to pick it up
on a related note: we currently have some redundancy in /etc/profile.d/gopath.sh and goroot.sh
im going to clean that up, but I think I will retain the CGO settings from gopath from now until we can be sure they can be safely removed
(in theory the makefile sets those now, but I am not sure if everyone is using make yet)
<@U0TFEHX8E>: I confirmed that it all seems to work even without the -a, at least via the new method
hmm, scratch that, the system booted ok, “make protos” runs ok, but “make unit-test” is failing with a suspect message
<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F1A8ZDF7V/-.sh|Untitled>

file.name: -.sh
file.title: Untitled

text: oh wait, that is just slop from development
(see the OPATH
yeah, everything is fine after I cleaned up the fs
<@U0Z81GL6S|anya> has joined the channel
<@U0KPFAZNF>:  ok, were you going to submit a PR to remove the -a or do you want me to?
Also, re the REST port question. I don’t know, it has always been like that, but it bugs me also
Maybe <@U0Z81GL6S> or <@U0UKTPMG8> knows? Why is the REST port mapped from 3000 to 5000? Why not just map it to 3000 like the other forwarded ports in vagrant?
<@U0TFEHX8E>: just leftover from initial setup.  No specific reason.
nice, let’s change it then. I’ll probably need to update some docs. Anything else where 5000 would be hardcoded?
I agree with <@U0UKTPMG8> . I think it was just left over from when we first set this up. Map it to 3000 in vagrant. You will need to update the CoreAPI.md as well as the SandboxSetup.md files.
<@U0Z81GL6S>: thanks! And welcome back! You have IO swag for all of us, right?? :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm still there :blush:. Back in office on Monday.
ah. have fun!
IO is Wed--Fri. #nerdfest
<@U0TFEHX8E>: ill fix the -a in my upcoming makefile PR
regarding the port, note that the peer surfaces port 5000 and then vagrant remaps it to 3000 for clients outside devenv
i assume we want to retain 5000? or should the peer change its port too?
<@U0TFEHX8E>: im just wrapping up testing on this now: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/compare/master...ghaskins:build-improvements-v1>

text: that includes the -a change
oh, I guess I lived in node too long and assumed 3000 was default. How was 5000 chosen?
I’m fine with keeping 5000
im not sure, thats why I was asking…i dont care what it is really, my only pain was that my tool’s defaults didnt work depending on whether I was inside or outside of vagrant
yup. Will just make 5000 -> 5000 in the vagrantfile
now that I got #1502 is in.. adding z support
